movie_title: Can we live without plastic? ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Is it time to start living without plastic? Neil and Beth discuss this and teach you some useful voc

vocabulary.definition: to decay naturally in a way that is not harmful to the environment
vocabulary.example: Natural materials like paper biodegrade and turn back into soil.

vocabulary.definition: describing a non-natural material made by combining chemicals
vocabulary.example: Plastic is a synthetic material, not found in nature.

vocabulary.definition: tiny plastic particles found in products like toothpastes and body scrubs
vocabulary.example: Many countries have banned the use of microbeads in cosmetic products.

vocabulary.definition: ugly and unpleasant to look at
vocabulary.example: The garbage on the beach was unsightly and needed to be cleaned up.

vocabulary.definition: very rare or not happening very often
vocabulary.example: Plastic-eating microbes are few and far between, making plastic pollution a major issue.

vocabulary.definition: able to bend easily without breaking
vocabulary.example: Plastic is a flexible material that can be molded into various shapes.
